title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For using the expression for deBroglie wavelength

λ=h/p or h/mv

Determining the speed from the kinetic energy K:

K =  1 2 m v 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E30@

v=  2K/m MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA3@

1 point is earned: For including the conversion of K from eV to joules

1 point is earned: For correctly determining the velocity

v=  2( 3.70 eV )( 1.6× 1 0 −19  J/eV )/( 9.11× 1 0 −31  kg )  =1.14× 1 0 6  m/s MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6A5E@

1 point is earned:
λ = (6.63 x 10-34J · s) / (9.11 x 10-31kg) (1.14 x 106 m/s)

1 point is earned:

λ = 6.38 x 10-10 m

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For using the correct equation relating wavelength to energy, or an equivalent combination of equations

λ = hc/E (or a combination such as E = hf and f = c/λ

The energy E is equal to the kinetic energy of the electrons. Substituting for hc and E:

λ = (1.24 x 103 eV⋅nm)/(3.70 ev) or equivalent calculation using joules

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

λ = 335 nm
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned: For using the correct equation relating wavelength to energy, or an equivalent combination of equations

λ = hc/E (or a combination such as E = hf and f = c/λ

The energy E is equal to the kinetic energy of the electrons. Substituting for hc and E:

λ = (1.24 x 103 eV⋅nm)/(3.70 ev) or equivalent calculation using joules

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

λ = 335 nm

The student response earns one of the following points:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a diagram with correctly labeled levels or some identification of the relative energies

2 points are earned: For an indication of the additional transition of 1.2 eV
